Description: The unique identification number for a complaint
How the complaint was submitted to the CFPB
The date the CFPB received the complaint
The date the CFPB sent the complaint to the company
The state of the mailing address provided by the consumer
The type of product the consumer identified in the complaint
The type of sub-product the consumer identified in the complaint (not all Products have Sub-products)
The issue the consumer identified in the complaint (possible values are dependent on Product)
The sub-issue the consumer identified in the complaint (oossible values are dependent on Product and Issue, and not all Issues have corresponding Sub-issues)

The company's optional, public-facing response to a consumer's complaint. Companies can choose to select a response from a pre-set list of options that will be posted on the public database. For example, "Company believes complaint is the result of an isolated error."
This is how the company responded. For example, "Closed with explanation."
Whether the company gave a timely response (Yes/No)
